analyzed: sgom pa po ni sems so //
translated: The meditator is the mind.

original: de gsum ka yang med de rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gsum ka yang med de rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All three of those do not exist because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshes dang dgra med ni bshes zhes pa ni sems te de med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshes dang dgra med ni bshes zhes pa ni sems te de med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is neither friend nor enemy. Friend refers to the mind, which does not exist.

original: dgra zhes pa ni dgra rnams te de dang 'dra bas na gang yang yul dang dbang po de rnams kyang med do //
analyzed: dgra zhes pa ni dgra rnams te de dang 'dra bas na gang yang yul dang dbang po de rnams kyang med do //
translated: Enemy refers to enemies, which are similar to that. Therefore, the objects and sense organs do not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the three vajras are inseparable.

original: yang na bshes ni mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bshes ni mdza' ba'o //
translated: Or else, friend is affection.

original: dgra ni mi mdza' ba'o //
analyzed: dgra ni mi mdza' ba'o //
translated: Enemy is aversion.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang med pa'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang med pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is neither virtue nor nonvirtue.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag na /
analyzed: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag na /
translated: When water is placed in water,

original: de snyed chu ru ro mnyam 'gyur //
analyzed: de snyed chu ru ro mnyam 'gyur //
translated: it becomes of the same taste as the water.

original: skyon dang yon tan rnam ldan sems //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan rnam ldan sems //
translated: The mind has both faults and qualities,

original: rmongs pa gnyen po cung zad med //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: rmongs pa gnyen po cung zad med //üîΩces gsungs so //
translated: but the deluded have no antidote at all.

original: 'di thams cad ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ji ltar yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: He explains how all this is:

original: rlom sems med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa sna tshogs nyid //
translated: The innate variety, free of conceptual thought,

original: rlabs dang 'dra bas rba rlabs te rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rlabs dang 'dra bas rba rlabs te rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: is like waves, and so is called ‚Äúwave.‚Äù

original: de las byung ba gang la lhan cig skyes par bshad de rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir de lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba gang la lhan cig skyes par bshad de rnam par rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir de lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: That from which it arises is explained as innate, because it is beyond all conceptual thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs ni gzugs sna tshogs te thams cad nyid de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs ni gzugs sna tshogs te thams cad nyid de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: That is why ‚Äúvariety‚Äù is the variety of forms, everything itself, included within it by its very nature.

original: rdo rje'i snying pos 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying pos 'di skad gsol //
translated: Vajragarbha asked this:

original: gzod nas rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gzod nas rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is primordially without inherent existence.‚Äù

original: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa ni //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin dag pa ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the body is pure.

original: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
analyzed: ci slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags //
translated: Why is it the nature of the elements?‚Äù

original: rdo rje snying po zhes pa ni rdo rje'i snying po ste mi phyed pa'i sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po zhes pa ni rdo rje'i snying po ste mi phyed pa'i sku yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajragarbha is the essence of vajra, because it is the indivisible body.

original: gsol ba ni zhu ba ste /
analyzed: gsol ba ni zhu ba ste /
translated: Asked is requested.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is addressed to Vajradhara.

original: rgyu ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: For what reason?

original: gang gi phyir mchog dga' bsgom pa dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams bkag pa de'i phyir the tshom skyes nas gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog dga' bsgom pa dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams bkag pa de'i phyir the tshom skyes nas gsol pa'o //
translated: Because the meditation and the meditator, etc. have been refuted, therefore, having given rise to doubt, he asks.

original: lus kyi ni lus lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus kyi ni lus lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The body is the innate nature of the body.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin las ji lta ba bzhin gyi yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin las ji lta ba bzhin gyi yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The nature is the reality just as it is.

original: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity is the natural purity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzod nas ni dang po nyid @125b nas sa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzod nas ni dang po nyid @125b nas sa //
translated: Therefore, from the beginning, from the very beginning,

original: rang bzhin med pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa ste /
translated: the absence of nature is not the reality just as it is.

original: gang de ltar /
analyzed: gang de ltar /
translated: That being so,

original: ce slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags ni ji ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ce slad 'byung ba'i bdag nyid lags ni ji ltar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: how is it the nature of the five great elements?

original: de la bcom ldan rdo rje can /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan rdo rje can /
translated: To that, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder,

original: mkha' 'gro bde ba sbyin pas gsungs //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro bde ba sbyin pas gsungs //
translated: the dakini, the bestower of bliss, spoke:üîΩThe nature of the self, which is free from conceit,

original: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag / thams cad lus la rnam par gnas //
translated: resides in all bodies.

original: de la zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni rdo rje snying po'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The there is the Vajragarbha Tantra.

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can ni rdo rje'i 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can ni rdo rje'i 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Vajra-holder is Vajradhara.

original: gsungs pa ni bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The statement is the pronouncement.

original: cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: How is it distinguished?

original: mkha' 'gro ni bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ni bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The dakinis are Nairatmya and so on.

original: bde ba ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba ni ye shes so //
translated: The bliss is the intuition.

original: sbyin pa ni bde ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni bde ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: The granting is the bestowal of bliss.

original: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The self is the nature of non-imagination, the nature of non-conceit.

original: bdag ni lus te gang la de yod pa de ni rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag go //
analyzed: bdag ni lus te gang la de yod pa de ni rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin bdag go //
translated: The self is the body, and he who has that is the self of the nature of non-conceit.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: thams cad lus la rnam par gnas ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po mtha' dag la rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad lus la rnam par gnas ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po mtha' dag la rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: all things abide in the body, abiding in all things, moving and unmoving, and so on.

original: khyad du 'phags pa'i tshul gyis aa ba ste /
analyzed: khyad du 'phags pa'i tshul gyis aa ba ste /
translated: The manner is the manner of distinction.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: The a is Nairatmya.

original: ba rdo rje 'dzin pa yin pas aa ba'o //
analyzed: ba rdo rje 'dzin pa yin pas aa ba'o //
translated: The va is the Vajra-holder, so it is the a-va.

original: rim pa 'dis na brtan pa dang g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis na brtan pa dang g-yo ba yin no //
translated: By this process, it is the moving and unmoving.

original: ci'i slad du 'byung ba chen po'i phung po lags zhes pa yin pa de gsungs pa kho la ka kko la sbyor bas ;
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'byung ba chen po'i phung po lags zhes pa yin pa de gsungs pa kho la ka kko la sbyor bas ;
translated: Why is it the aggregate of the great elements?

original: / sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: / sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The earth is born from that,üîΩfrom the union of vajra and lotus.

original: de la ni lhan cig skyes pa las sa'i khams skyes ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni lhan cig skyes pa las sa'i khams skyes ba'o //
translated: From that, the earth element is born, born from the innate.

original: bo la rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bo la rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra is the male organ.

original: ka kko la padma'o //
analyzed: ka kko la padma'o //
translated: Lotus is the female organ.

original: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa yin pa zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa yin pa zhes dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the vajra and lotus are united.

original: slar dang po reg par 'dod pa ste /üîΩreg pas sra ba'i chos kyis ni //
analyzed: slar dang po reg par 'dod pa ste / reg pas sra ba'i chos kyis ni //
translated: First, the desire for contact,üîΩthrough the words ‚Äúcontact is the quality of solidity.‚Äù

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis te sa yang sra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis te sa yang sra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because earth is understood to have the nature of solidity.

original: sa'i khams de la dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis lhan cig skyes pa las skye'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams de la dga' ba'i rang bzhin gyis lhan cig skyes pa las skye'o //
translated: The earth element is born from that, born from the innate, through the nature of joy.

original: byang sems khu ba'i rnam pa las //
analyzed: byang sems khu ba'i rnam pa las //
translated: From the bodhicitta, which is in the form of semen,

original: chu yi khams su yang ni 'gyur //
analyzed: chu yi khams su yang ni 'gyur //
translated: the water element is also born.

original: lhan cig skyes pa de las ni byang chub kyi sems 'byung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de las ni byang chub kyi sems 'byung ste /
translated: From that innate, the bodhicitta arises.

original: khu ba skye zhing de yang khu ba'i tshul nyid kyi phyir chu'i khams so //
analyzed: khu ba skye zhing de yang khu ba'i tshul nyid kyi phyir chu'i khams so //
translated: and that is the water element, because it is in the form of water.

original: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising means origination.

original: bskyod pa las ni me yin te /
analyzed: bskyod pa las ni me yin te /
translated: From the shaking, fire;

original: rdo rje padma bskyod pa las me'i khams skye'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padma bskyod pa las me'i khams skye'o //
translated: from the shaking of the vajra and lotus, the fire element arises.

original: 'gro ba rlung du rab tu grags /
analyzed: 'gro ba rlung du rab tu grags /
translated: The going is well known as air;

original: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rlung gi khams su bstan to //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rlung gi khams su bstan to //
translated: it is taught as the air element, because it has the nature of movement.

original: bde ba yang ni nam mkha'i khams //üîΩnam mkha'i @126a * //
analyzed: bde ba yang ni nam mkha'i khams // nam mkha'i @126a * //
translated: And bliss is the space element.

original: khams bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The space element is the nature of bliss.

original: 'dis ni lnga pa rnams kyi sa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: 'dis ni lnga pa rnams kyi sa ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po lnga rnams so //
translated: Here, the five elements are the five great elements, earth, etc.

original: yongs su bskor ni thams cad la khyab pa de'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ni thams cad la khyab pa de'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The one who is surrounded by them is the innate one who pervades all.

original: 'dis ni phan pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyi lus lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phan pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyi lus lhan cig skyes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: This innate wisdom of the body, which has the nature of the great elements, is the characteristic of benefit.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang rnam par chags pa 'dres par gyur pa chu la chu bzhag pa lta bu'i bdag med ma'i byang chub kyi sems thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam pa
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang rnam par chags pa 'dres par gyur pa chu la chu bzhag pa lta bu'i bdag med ma'i byang chub kyi sems thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin rnam pa
translated: Therefore, desire and attachment are mixed like water poured into water.üîΩThe bodhicitta of NairƒÅtmya is the nature of the two truths, method and wisdom inseparable, the nature of the five gnoses and the three kƒÅyas.üîΩ

original: thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, desire and passion, which are mixed together like water poured into water, are the cause for the manifest enlightenment of omniscience, which is the nature of the two truths, the indivisible wisdom of method and wisdom, the nature of the five wisdoms and three bodies, and all aspects.

original: rdo rje snying po'i the tshom bcom ldan 'das kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po'i the tshom bcom ldan 'das kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has removed the doubts of Vajragarbha.

original: yang na mchog dga' rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma'i ye shes bsgom pa dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mchog dga' rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma'i ye shes bsgom pa dang sgom pa po la sogs pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is because the supreme joy, the vajra holder, the meditation on the wisdom of NairƒÅtmya, the meditator, and so on, are not observed.

original: 'di skad ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ni rgyu'o //
translated: This is the cause.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes su bstan to //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes su bstan to //
translated: The one called Hevajra is taught to be the wisdom of the vajra holder, who is inseparable from NairƒÅtmya.

original: yang dag pa'i bdag nyid ni yang dag pa de nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang de ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bdag nyid ni yang dag pa de nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang de ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The nature of reality is the nature of reality itself, the unmistaken nature, which is the pristine consciousness of the nature of the elements.

original: ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin gyis te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis te yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is by nature, just as it is.

original: lus dag ni lus ni sku gsum ste ma ning du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dag ni lus ni sku gsum ste ma ning du bstan pa'o //
translated: The body is the three bodies, explained as the neutral state.

original: gang gzod nas ni dang po nyid nas so //
analyzed: gang gzod nas ni dang po nyid nas so //
translated: Since the beginning is from the beginning,

original: rang bzhin med pa ni med ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa ni med ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: the nature is the nature of nonexistence.

original: rang rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs own is the vajra holder.

original: bzhin ni gnyis ka'i gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bzhin ni gnyis ka'i gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature is the nature of both.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The pristine consciousness of bliss is like that.

original: de la zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni de ltar rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù means in that way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:

original: yi ge aa dang yi ge ha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang yi ge ha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the letter A and the letter H.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Endowed with all the qualities of ƒ™≈õvara and so on.

original: rdo rje can ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The vajra-holder is the body of indivisible intuition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i bde ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni bdag med ma la sogs pa'i bde ba'i ye shes so //
translated: the dakinis are the intuitions of bliss such as Nairatmya.

original: sbyin pa ni spyan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni spyan pa'o //
translated: The giving is the opening.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyang ye shes de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de'i nang du thim pa yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyang ye shes de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de'i nang du thim pa yin pa'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, they also dissolve into that, since they are of the nature of that intuition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin can ni rtog pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rlom sems med pa'i rang bzhin can ni rtog pa thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
translated: the nature of non-imagination is the abandonment of all conceptual thoughts.

original: thams cad lus ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i lus la rnam @126b par gnas pa khyab pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad lus ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i lus la rnam @126b par gnas pa khyab pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The body of all is the immovability, since it pervades the bodies of the animate and inanimate.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Such is the vajra-holder.

original: de nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la'o //
translated: In that very [intuition],

original: sa skye ba ni de nyid bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sa skye ba ni de nyid bdag med ma'i rang bzhin du bskyod pa'o //
translated: the arising of the earth is the shaking of that, which is of the nature of Nairatmya.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor las /
analyzed: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor las /
translated: From the union of the vajra and lotus,

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the inseparability of both arises.

original: 'dis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the creation stage.

original: de nyid byang chub sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That itself is the bodhicitta, the nature of the bodhicitta of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: khu ba'i rnam pa ni mer mer po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu ba'i rnam pa ni mer mer po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of the semen is the nature of the kalala.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chu'i khams te rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //üîΩskye bar 'gyur ni yang dag par 'byung bas na skye ba ste /

original: bskyod pa las ni me yin te //
analyzed: bskyod pa las ni me yin te //

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //

analyzed: de nas yang 'gro bas ni rtog pa las so //

analyzed: rlung ni ye shes so //

analyzed: grags ni gsal ba rab tu gsal ba'o //

original: yongs su ni kun nas so //
analyzed: yongs su ni kun nas so //

analyzed: bskor ba ni khyab pa'o ;

analyzed: cad bde mchog gcig ni gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis bsdu ba yin no //

analyzed: yang na rang gi sems dang yul dang dbang po'i dngos po dag 'di gsum gyi rang bzhin ni ma ning lhan cig skyes pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Or else, one‚Äôs own mind, the object, and the entity of the sense organ‚Äîthe nature of these three is taught as the ‚Äúcoemergent neutral state.‚Äù

original: thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Everything‚Äù is Vajradhara.üîΩ‚Äú

original: aa bdag med ma'o //

analyzed: de ltar thams cad gnyi ga'i bya ba byed pa rnam pa thams cad do //

original: de yang gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad gcig go //

analyzed: de ltar bur gyur pa'i ye shes bde ba ni ye shes te rnam pa thams cad sdom pa'o //

translated: That sublime gnosis, which causes both the vajra-holder and NairƒÅtmya to become nondual, is just this innate, authentic gnosis.

original: bde bar nyams su myong ba'i ye shes su ni kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: bde bar nyams su myong ba'i ye shes su ni kha cig 'dod do //

original: de yang nyen thos dang mu stegs pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de yang nyen thos dang mu stegs pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: That is also the case for the ≈õrƒÅvakas and tƒ´rthikas.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / phyag rgya rgyu dang bral ba las ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyag rgya rgyu dang bral ba las ;
translated: The mudrƒÅ is free from causes,

original: / rnal 'byor snying rje thabs su 'gyur //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ba zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid ci 'dra bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: phyag rgya zhes pa ni shes rab po //

analyzed: de nyid thabs kyis rgyu las bsgral bar 'dod pas so //

original: ji ltar zhen /

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //

analyzed: snying rje ni sems so //

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn has said:

analyzed: sems nyid de bzhin nyid la de bzhin nyid sems yin pa 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med pa dbyer med la gcad du med pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi sems rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi ye shes yin par bshad do //
translated: That itself is explained as the nonconceptual wisdom of bodhicitta.

original: dran pa brjed ngas med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas shing bla ma dam pa'i zhabs la gnas pa'i don te /
analyzed: dran pa brjed ngas med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas shing bla ma dam pa'i zhabs la gnas pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of abiding in the yoga of nonforgetfulness and abiding at the feet of the sublime guru is

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // sngags kyi bzlas med dka' thub med dang sbyin sreg med //

original: dkyil 'khor ba yang med cing dkyil 'khor yang ni med //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba yang med cing dkyil 'khor yang ni med //
translated: no ma·πá·∏çala, and no ma·πá·∏çala master.

analyzed: dka' thub mi bya'o //

analyzed: sbyin sreg mi bya'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid de ni sngags kyi bzlas pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid dka' thub po //

analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor ba'i lha'i tshul lo //

analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor ro //

analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni mdor bsdus pa ste bsdu ba'o //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: mdor bsdus na ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ste /

analyzed: mtha' dag dbyer med pa nyid de 'phags pa yin pas mdor bsdu ba'o //
translated: the indivisibility of all is the ƒÅrya, and thus it is a brief summary.

original: gang sems ni 'dus pa'i tshul can ni /
analyzed: gang sems ni 'dus pa'i tshul can ni /
translated: The line the mind is the form of the gathering

analyzed: sems 'dus pa ni sems 'dus pa ste sems kyang de'i nang du thim pa yin no //

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul 'di rdo rje 'dzin pa la yod pas sems ni 'dus pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: Since this method exists for the vajra holder, the mind is the form of the gathering.

original: gang sems de 'dus pa'i tshul can de ni rang 'byung zhing sems las 'das pa de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor nyid kyis de nyid gnyi ga snyoms par zhugs pas bzlas pa dang dka' thub dang sbyin sreg gi rang
analyzed: gang sems de 'dus pa'i tshul can de ni rang 'byung zhing sems las 'das pa de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor nyid kyis de nyid gnyi ga snyoms par zhugs pas bzlas pa dang dka' thub dang sbyin sreg gi rang
translated: That very [mind] is the ma·πá·∏çala of the nature of method and wisdom, and by the ma·πá·∏çala itself entering into union with that, [it is] the nature of recitation, austerity, and burnt offering.üîΩBy that very [nature], the nature of the three vajras is the nature of the assembly of all.üîΩBy that, the five pristine consciousnesses and the three kƒÅyas are the nature of method and wisdom.

original: bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin thams cad bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des kyang ye shes lnga dang sku gsum thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rang 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin nyid kyis rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin thams cad bsdu ba'i bdag nyid des kyang ye shes lnga dang sku gsum thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rang 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o //
translated: The stage of the empowerment conferral of the self-originated vajra-holder is distinguished.

original: mngon par kun nas dbang dri ma med par byed pas na dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par kun nas dbang dri ma med par byed pas na dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Since the stainless empowerment is conferred, it is the empowerment.

original: gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is the purity of both.

original: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gos ni 'gebs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the cloth is the covering.

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o ;
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba'o ;
translated: Since it takes up and holds that, it is the stage of the empowerment conferral.

original: / bcu pa'o zhes pa ni bcu po rnams ni rdzogs pas na bcu po ste /
analyzed: / bcu pa'o zhes pa ni bcu po rnams ni rdzogs pas na bcu po ste /
translated: The tenth means that the tenth is complete.

original: mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / bdag med ma dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma brgyad dang / bdag med ma dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The eight dakinis, Nairatmya, and Vajradhara.

original: yang na dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba ste bcu pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the tenth chapter of the section on the consecration of the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor yang yin la dbang bskur ba yang yin pas na dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang yin la dbang bskur ba yang yin pas na dkyil 'khor dbang bskur ba'i rim par phye ba ste bcu pa'o //
translated: Since it is both a mandala and a consecration, it is the tenth chapter of the section on the consecration of the mandala.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the tenth chapter of the commentary on the glorious Hevajra, called Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / da ni dbang bskur bas de kho na nyid shes la de kho na nyid shes pas lta stangs bzhi yis sems can gzhug @128b par bya ba'i phyir mngon du gyur pas na /
analyzed: // / da ni dbang bskur bas de kho na nyid shes la de kho na nyid shes pas lta stangs bzhi yis sems can gzhug @128b par bya ba'i phyir mngon du gyur pas na /
translated: Now, in order to introduce sentient beings with the four gazes of one who knows reality through consecration and knows reality, the first chapter of the section is stated in brief: The gaze of summoning, and so on.

original: rim par phye ba dang por mdor bstan pa'i lta stangs dgug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: rim par phye ba dang por mdor bstan pa'i lta stangs dgug dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nus pa rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The power of the nine gazes taught in the first chapter is stated extensively.

original: mnyam par ma rungs dpral ba can //
analyzed: mnyam par ma rungs dpral ba can //
translated: The even, the crooked, the forehead,

original: rtag tu ltung bar byed par brjod //
analyzed: rtag tu ltung bar byed par brjod //
translated: are always said to be the casting down.

original: mnyam pa zhes pa ni yon po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes pa ni yon po ma yin pa'o //

original: ma rungs pa ni ma rungs pa'i las byed pa can no //
analyzed: ma rungs pa ni ma rungs pa'i las byed pa can no //

original: dpral ba can ni dpral ba'i gnas kyi sgos so //
analyzed: dpral ba can ni dpral ba'i gnas kyi sgos so //
translated: Forehead means by the forehead place.

original: ltung bar byed ni 'gyel bar byed pa'i sgo nas te gsad pa'i lta stangs bstan to //
analyzed: ltung bar byed ni 'gyel bar byed pa'i sgo nas te gsad pa'i lta stangs bstan to //

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni rtag par rgyun du bsgom par byas pas te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni rtag par rgyun du bsgom par byas pas te /
translated: Always means by always cultivating continuously.

original: thams cad nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad nyid du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All should be applied.

original: dbang gi lta stangs g-yon na gnas //
analyzed: dbang gi lta stangs g-yon na gnas //

original: 'bras bu gnyis ni g-yon nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis ni g-yon nyid du'o //

original: dbang du bya bar rigs pa dbang du bya ba ste dbang du bya ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: dbang du bya bar rigs pa dbang du bya ba ste dbang du bya ba'i sgo nas so //

analyzed: g-yon na gnas ni g-yon gyi gnas su 'bras bu gnyis gnas pas so //

analyzed: de'i lta stangs g-yon nyid du'o ni g-yon ngos nyid du bzlog nas blta ba'o //

analyzed: g-yas pa'i cha la dgug pa nyid /

original: gnyi ga stong du nges par sbyar //
analyzed: gnyi ga stong du nges par sbyar //

analyzed: dgug pa nyid ces pa ni dgug par bya ba'o //

original: g-yas pa'i cha la ni g-yas ngos su'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i cha la ni g-yas ngos su'o //

original: gnyi ga zhes pa ni 'bras bu gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes pa ni 'bras bu gnyis so //

original: steng du zhes pa ni steng du'o //
analyzed: steng du zhes pa ni steng du'o //

original: nges par sbyar ni gzhag par bya'o //üîΩdbu ma rengs pa'i lta stangs nyid //
analyzed: nges par sbyar ni gzhag par bya'o // dbu ma rengs pa'i lta stangs nyid //

original: sna'i rtse ma'i dbus su gnyis //
analyzed: sna'i rtse ma'i dbus su gnyis //

original: dbu ma zhes pa ni dbus su gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dbu ma zhes pa ni dbus su gnas pa ste /

original: steng du yang ma yin 'og nas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: steng du yang ma yin 'og nas kyang ma yin /

original: g-yon dang g-yas su yang mi gzhag pa'o //

original: gnyis zhes pa ni 'bras bu gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis zhes pa ni 'bras bu gnyis so //

analyzed: lhung bar byed pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams kyi rlung ni 'jug pa'i rlung gis dgug pa goms par bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya la dgongs pas sgra ji lta ba bzhin du'o //

original: dbang ni zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dbang ni zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpowerment‚Äù is the gnosis of indivisibility.

analyzed: rdo rje'i shing la zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes rnams la'o //

original: dgug pa zhes pa ni bsdu ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dgug pa zhes pa ni bsdu ba'i ye shes so //

original: g-yo bcas rtsa ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bcas rtsa ni brtan pa'o //

original: cis khyad 'phags she na g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: cis khyad 'phags she na g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: How are they distinguished? They are moving and firm.

analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba dbyer med par yod pa'i mi g-yo ba'i ye shes ni rengs pa'o //

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni rtag tu'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni rtag tu'o //
translated: Always means constantly.üîΩIt is accomplished by constant training with devotion.

original: rtag tu gus pa dang bcas par sbyangs pas goms pa nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtag tu gus pa dang bcas par sbyangs pas goms pa nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pa de gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: zla drug goms par sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: zla drug goms par sbyor ba yis //
translated: By training for six months,

original: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: there is accomplishment, there is no doubt.

original: 'di la 'khrul bar mi bya ste //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul bar mi bya ste //
translated: One should not be mistaken about this,

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul bsam mi khyab //
translated: because the miracles of the buddhas are inconceivable.

original: zla ba drug gis lta stangs bzhi po 'di gdon mi za bar 'grub pas tha tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis lta stangs bzhi po 'di gdon mi za bar 'grub pas tha tshom mi bya'o //
translated: Since these four gazes are definitely accomplished in six months, there is no doubt.

original: lta stangs 'grub pa yang 'khrul par mi bya ste /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dngos grub ste mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i lta stangs 'di rnams sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul te /
analyzed: lta stangs 'grub pa yang 'khrul par mi bya ste / gang gi phyir 'di yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dngos grub ste mngon par zhen pa med pa nyid du de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i lta stangs 'di rnams sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul te /
translated: One should not mistake the accomplishment of the gazes,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rol pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rol pa'o //
translated: because this is also an inconceivable feat, the Buddha's magic, the Buddha's play, these gazes endowed with reality, which are just without attachment.

original: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab kyi sems can gzhug par bya ba'i phyir de nas de gsungs pa /
analyzed: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab kyi sems can gzhug par bya ba'i phyir de nas de gsungs pa /
translated: In order to introduce sentient beings of the lowest, middling, and best faculties, then that is stated.

original: lta stangs bzhi po bsgrubs nas ni //
analyzed: lta stangs bzhi po bsgrubs nas ni //
translated: Having accomplished the four gazes,

original: mkhas pas sems can 'jug par byed //
analyzed: mkhas pas sems can 'jug par byed //
translated: the wise one introduces sentient beings.

original: lta stangs bzhi bsgrubs nas yang dag pa'i lam la sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lta stangs bzhi bsgrubs nas yang dag pa'i lam la sems can rnams gzhug pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having accomplished the four gazes, in order to introduce sentient beings to the true path, is the meaning.

original: yang na zla drug ni drug gi sgras drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zla drug ni drug gi sgras drug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or, the six months are the sixth, Vajradhara, with the word ‚Äúsix.‚Äù

original: drug pa'i tshul gyis yid ma ste grangs drug pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa'i tshul gyis yid ma ste grangs drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the mind, with the method of the sixth.

original: de 'dir 'phen par byed pas na zla ba drug ste drug pa rdo rje 'dzin par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir 'phen par byed pas na zla ba drug ste drug pa rdo rje 'dzin par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is what propels one here, it is the sixth, the vajra holder.

original: ji ltar yod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa gsungs pa /
translated: How does it exist?

original: goms par sbyor ba yis ni sbyor bas rnal 'byor 'dus pa thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: goms par sbyor ba yis ni sbyor bas rnal 'byor 'dus pa thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is the yoga of practice, the union of method and wisdom, which is indivisible.

original: goms pa ni rtag tu goms pas rgyun du sbyor bas so //
analyzed: goms pa ni rtag tu goms pas rgyun du sbyor bas so //
translated: Practice is constant practice, continuous application.

original: des 'grub par 'gyur ba ste the tshom med do //
analyzed: des 'grub par 'gyur ba ste the tshom med do //
translated: By that, one will accomplish it, without a doubt.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di la 'khrul par mi bya ste 'di la rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul par mi bya ste 'di la rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: one should not err in this regard, nor should one have doubts.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul ni mngon shes drug gi yon tan no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul ni mngon shes drug gi yon tan no //
translated: Because the buddha‚Äôs magic is the quality of the six higher perceptions.

original: de bsam gyis mi khyab ni bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsam gyis mi khyab ni bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is inconceivable because it is beyond thought.

original: de nyid bya ba ste bya @130a * //
analyzed: de nyid bya ba ste bya @130a * //
translated: That itself is the action, the result.

original: pa'o ; /'bras bu'i tshul rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'bras bu'i tshul rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The vajra holder is the manner of the result.

original: de yang aa ste ye ge aa la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin tsheg drag gi mtha' can no //
analyzed: de yang aa ste ye ge aa la sogs pa mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin tsheg drag gi mtha' can no //
translated: The a is the nature of the fifteen dakinis, ending with the visarga.

original: lta stang bzhi po bsgrubs nas ni //
analyzed: lta stang bzhi po bsgrubs nas ni //
translated: Having accomplished the four gazes,

original: zhes pa ni ye shes bzhi po bsgrub ces pa sems dpa' srid gsum dbyer med pa'i pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes bzhi po bsgrub ces pa sems dpa' srid gsum dbyer med pa'i pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the accomplishment of the four gnoses is the gnosis of the indivisibility of the three existences of the sattva.

original: aa ba'i aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa ba'i aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: The a is NairƒÅtmya,

original: ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and the va is Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa aa pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa aa pa'o //
translated: The indivisibility of both is the a va.

original: 'jug pa ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni khyab pa'o //
translated: The pervading is the emanation.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid spro ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid spro ba yin no //
translated: The indivisibility of both is the emanation.

original: mkhas pa ni ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i don to //üîΩlta stangs bzhi las gsum ni 'bras bu yod pa yin te sems can gzhug par bya bar gyur kyang gsad pa'i lta stangs kyang re zhig sems can 'jug par byed pa zhog gi sems can la gnod par byed pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa de gsungs pa
analyzed: mkhas pa ni ye shes gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i don to // lta stangs bzhi las gsum ni 'bras bu yod pa yin te sems can gzhug par bya bar gyur kyang gsad pa'i lta stangs kyang re zhig sems can 'jug par byed pa zhog gi sems can la gnod par byed pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa de gsungs pa
translated: The expert means the meaning of the nature of one gnosis.üîΩ From among the four gazes, the first three are effective, but the gaze of killing is not effective for sentient beings.

original: / gsad par 'di la bya ma yin /
analyzed: / gsad par 'di la bya ma yin /
translated: It is said that this is not for killing sentient beings.

original: dam tshig nges par nyams par gyur //
analyzed: dam tshig nges par nyams par gyur //
translated: One certainly violates the vow.

original: gsad par bya ba ci yang med de skyon gyi khyad par de kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba ci yang med de skyon gyi khyad par de kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: There is nothing at all to be killed, and only that particular fault arises.

original: dam tshig nyams zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dam tshig nyams zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOne violates the vow‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bka' khyad du bsad par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bka' khyad du bsad par gyur pa yin no //
translated: means that one disregards the words of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: nges par gzhan du yang bkag pa brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges par gzhan du yang bkag pa brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCertainly‚Äù means that one should practice lying and so forth, which are prohibited for others.

original: yang gsad par mi bya ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsad par mi bya ba de gsungs pa /
translated: Again, he states that one should not kill:

original: sems can slu ba ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: sems can slu ba ma gtogs pa //
translated: ‚ÄúExcept for deceiving sentient beings,

original: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
translated: one should do everything that is not to be done.‚Äù

original: srog bcad pas mi dge ba kun skye'o //
analyzed: srog bcad pas mi dge ba kun skye'o //
translated: All nonvirtue arises from killing.

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa rnams la mi dge ba med do //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa rnams la mi dge ba med do //
translated: There is no nonvirtue in lying and so forth.

original: sems can la gnod pa byas pa'i mi dge ba'i skyon ci yin pa de gsungs pa /üîΩsems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa byas pa'i mi dge ba'i skyon ci yin pa de gsungs pa / sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni /
translated: He states the fault of nonvirtue that comes from harming sentient beings:üîΩ‚ÄúOne does not attain the feats of the seal

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: merely by harming sentient beings.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means that

original: gang phyir sems can la gnod pa byas pa gcig bus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub nyams pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang phyir sems can la gnod pa byas pa gcig bus phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub nyams pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by harming sentient beings alone, the spiritual power of the Great Seal is destroyed.

original: 'di ni 'di nyid gsad par mi bya bar gcig kyang de ci'i phyir goms par bya ba de bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di nyid gsad par mi bya bar gcig kyang de ci'i phyir goms par bya ba de bstan zhe na /
translated: If one should ask, ‚ÄúWhy should one not kill even one of these, and what is the purpose of cultivating them?‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la thams cad nyid sbyang dgos la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa la thams cad nyid sbyang dgos la /
translated: It is because in order to accomplish omniscience, all of them must be trained.

original: 'on kyang dor bya nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yang yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang dor bya nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa yang yin par dgongs so //
translated: However, it is also intended that they are to be established by way of what is to be abandoned.

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spyad par 'dod pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la yang des bslabs par gyur kyang ci ltar nyan thos kyis la gnas pa @130b yin ste ;
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spyad par 'dod pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la yang des bslabs par gyur kyang ci ltar nyan thos kyis la gnas pa @130b yin ste ;
translated: Just as one who wishes to practice for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, even though he has trained in the stages of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., is not a ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: / de'i sems ni dor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i sems ni dor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his mind is not to be abandoned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rlon pa'i shing la sbyang par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rlon pa'i shing la sbyang par bya ba yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they are to be cultivated like a wet log.

original: yang na gsad par gang bstan pa de thams cad sems can la gnod pa'i bsam pas mi bya bar gyur kyang ci sems can la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gsad par gang bstan pa de thams cad sems can la gnod pa'i bsam pas mi bya bar gyur kyang ci sems can la phan pa'i bsam pa nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: Or else, whatever is taught as killing, that should not be done with the intention of harming sentient beings, but should be done with the intention of benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa'i sems can ni dmyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dkon mchog gsum la gnod pa byed pa'i bsam pas zhugs pa'i sems can ni dmyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, a sentient being who has entered with the intention of harming the Three Jewels will go to hell.

original: de de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa can gyis de la phan pa'i blos bsad na mi bskyod pa'i rigs su khrid par byed do //
analyzed: de de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa can gyis de la phan pa'i blos bsad na mi bskyod pa'i rigs su khrid par byed do //
translated: But if that one is killed with the intention of compassion endowed with reality, with the thought of benefiting him, then one leads him to the family of Akshobhya.

original: yang khro bas zil gyis mnan pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod par byed pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang khro bas zil gyis mnan pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gnod par byed pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not with the intention of harming those who are overcome by anger, etc.

original: yang na / gsad par 'di la bya ba min par 'gyur ba ni gsad pa zhes pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams bsad nas yang dag pa'i ye shes su bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na / gsad par 'di la bya ba min par 'gyur ba ni gsad pa zhes pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams bsad nas yang dag pa'i ye shes su bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, killing should not be done here, that is, killing is the killing of the objects, sense faculties, and consciousnesses, in order to make them into correct wisdom.

original: 'gyur ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Becoming means completion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig nyams pa ni dam tshig ni lha rnams 'dus shing tshogs pas na dam tshig ste lha'i 'dus pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig nyams pa ni dam tshig ni lha rnams 'dus shing tshogs pas na dam tshig ste lha'i 'dus pa'o /
translated: Therefore, the one who has violated the commitments is the one who has violated the commitments of the assembly of deities, since the commitments are the assembly of deities.

original: de'i nyams pa ni lha rnams 'dus pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nyams pa ni lha rnams 'dus pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
translated: The violation of that is the absence of the conception of the assembly of deities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa ni mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa ni mchog go //
translated: Therefore, the certainty is the supreme.

original: 'gyur ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The transformation is the perfection.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the sphere of activity of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin thams cad bya //
translated: one should do everything that is not to be done.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Everything is the vajra holder.

original: aa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is NairƒÅtmya.

original: de ltar thams cad do //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad do //
translated: Thus, everything is both of them.

original: 'di gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid 'bras bu sku'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid 'bras bu sku'o //
translated: The inseparability of those two is the result, the body.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir sems can slu ba ni srid gsum gcig pa des yongs su bslus pa gang ngo //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir sems can slu ba ni srid gsum gcig pa des yongs su bslus pa gang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù; because the deception of sentient beings is the deception of the one who is the same as the three worlds.

original: de nyid ji ltar zhe na de gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar zhe na de gsungs pa //
translated: How is that? He says that.

original: grtogs pa bya zhes pa ste /
analyzed: grtogs pa bya zhes pa ste /
translated: One should understand.

original: bya ba ni bya ba bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni bya ba bya ba'o //
translated: Action is the performance of an action.

original: de yongs su spangs pas bya ba med pa'i phyir yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pas bya ba med pa'i phyir yin par dgongs so //
translated: By completely abandoning that, there is non-action. This is the intended meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,üîΩthe attainment of the seal is not obtained

original: sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni //üîΩphyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can gnod pa tsam gyis ni // phyag rgya'i dngos grub rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: by merely harming sentient beings.

original: sems can gnod pa'i sgras ni srid gsum gcig par rtogs pas so //
analyzed: sems can gnod pa'i sgras ni srid gsum gcig par rtogs pas so //
translated: The term ‚Äúharming sentient beings‚Äù means realizing the three worlds as one.

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub po //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub po //
translated: The attainment of the seal is the attainment of the great seal.

original: de yang rnyed mi 'gyur ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi thob pa'i yul gyi phyir yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rnyed mi 'gyur ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi thob pa'i yul gyi phyir yin pa'i don to //
translated: And that is not obtained means that the object of the attainment of the great seal is not obtained. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: de la dam tshig bza' bar bya //
analyzed: de la dam tshig bza' bar bya //
translated: one should consume the pledge.

original: na dang ga ha dang @131a * //
analyzed: na dang ga ha dang @131a * //
translated: Na, ga,

original: po dang // mtha' ma'i shva dang dang po'i shva //
analyzed: po dang // mtha' ma'i shva dang dang po'i shva //
translated: ha, and the final ≈õva, and the first ≈õva,

original: kye yi rdo rje'i dngos grub phyir //üîΩbdud rtsi lnga /
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje'i dngos grub phyir // bdud rtsi lnga /
translated: for the sake of the attainment of Hevajra,

original: nga de bzhin bza' //
analyzed: nga de bzhin bza' //
translated: one should consume the five nectars.

original: dam tshig lnga po gnyis po 'di lha rnams 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig lnga po gnyis po 'di lha rnams 'dus pa ste /
translated: The two sets of five pledges are the gathering of the deities.

original: dang po'i na la sogs pa ni yul rnams so //
analyzed: dang po'i na la sogs pa ni yul rnams so //
translated: The first na and so forth are the objects.

original: bdud rtsi ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The nectar is the sense organs.

original: dam tshig de gnyi ga yang ngo //
analyzed: dam tshig de gnyi ga yang ngo //
translated: The pledge is both of those.

original: bza' ba ni ro gcig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni ro gcig par bya ba'o //
translated: The eating is the making of one taste.

original: gang gi phyir bza' ba 'di ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bza' ba 'di ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Because this eating is of the nature of one taste, it is of the nature of purity.

original: ci'i don du zhe na dngos grub kyi phyir te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na dngos grub kyi phyir te phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi phyir ro //
translated: For what purpose? For the sake of spiritual powers, for the sake of the spiritual powers of the great seal.

original: gang la yod ce na dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sde gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes yod pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang la yod ce na dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sde gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i ye shes yod pa'i don to //
translated: In whom does it exist? In the one who has the wisdom of the indivisibility of the two realities of Hevajra.

original: kun rdzob kyi don du yang dam tshig yin te dam tshig ni bcu'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi don du yang dam tshig yin te dam tshig ni bcu'o //
translated: It is also a pledge in the sense of conventional reality, and the pledge is tenfold.

original: na dang zhes pa ni dam tshig gang la na dang por yod pa de ni na dang po ste rgyal po'i s'a li'o //
analyzed: na dang zhes pa ni dam tshig gang la na dang por yod pa de ni na dang po ste rgyal po'i s'a li'o //
translated: The first na and so forth is the pledge in which the syllable na is first, that is, the first na, which is the flesh of the king.

original: ha dang po zhes pa ni gang la yi ge ha dang por yod pa de ni ha dang po ste glang po che'i ste de'i sha'o //
analyzed: ha dang po zhes pa ni gang la yi ge ha dang por yod pa de ni ha dang po ste glang po che'i ste de'i sha'o //
translated: The first ha is the pledge in which the syllable ha is first, that is, the first ha, which is the flesh of the elephant.

original: de bzhin ga dang po zhes pa ni ba lang ste de'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ga dang po zhes pa ni ba lang ste de'i'o //
translated: The word first refers to the cow, and its refers to the cow's.

original: mtha' ma'i shva zhes pa ni rta'i'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma'i shva zhes pa ni rta'i'o //
translated: The word final refers to the horse, and first refers to the dog.

original: dang po'i shva zhes pa ni khyi'i'o //
analyzed: dang po'i shva zhes pa ni khyi'i'o //
translated: The word first refers to the dog, and final refers to the human.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five nectars are Vairochana and so forth.

original: kye rdo rje zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yod pa'o //
analyzed: kye rdo rje zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yod pa'o //
translated: The word Hevajra means the existence of nondual wisdom.

original: zos pa tsam gyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: zos pa tsam gyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special quality of attaining power merely by eating is stated:

original: na dang po rnyed nas so //
analyzed: na dang po rnyed nas so //
translated: First, having found,

original: skye ba bdun pa de nas brtag / kye'i rdo rjes gsungs mtshan nyid //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa de nas brtag / kye'i rdo rjes gsungs mtshan nyid //
translated: one should examine the seven-life one, the one spoken of by Hevajra, with the characteristics.

original: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa /
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa /
translated: The one who is contemptuous of the joy of separation from joy,

original: lan bdun pas ni 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: lan bdun pas ni 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: is accomplished by the seven-life one.

original: lan bdun pa'i sgras skye ba bdun pa'o //
analyzed: lan bdun pa'i sgras skye ba bdun pa'o //
translated: The word seven-life one refers to the seven-life one.

original: brtag pa ni mtshan mas mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni mtshan mas mtshon pa'o //
translated: Examination is indicated by the characteristics.

original: cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: kye'i rdo rjes gsungs pa ste dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyud kyis gsungs pas so //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rjes gsungs pa ste dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyud kyis gsungs pas so //
translated: Spoken of by Hevajra means spoken of by the Hevajra Tantra.

original: skye ba bdun pa de zos pa tsam gyis ni de'i sha zos pas dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa de zos pa tsam gyis ni de'i sha zos pas dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely eating that seven-times-born one, one will attain power through eating his flesh.

original: cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa ste /
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa ste /
translated: It is the revulsion of the revulsion of joy.

original: de yang dag pa'i ye shes smod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i ye shes smod pa ste /
translated: And that is the revulsion of correct wisdom.

original: gang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'grub pa de 'dis 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'grub pa de 'dis 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Whatever is accomplished by correct wisdom is accomplished by this.

original: skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa /
translated: The characteristics of the seven-times-born one are taught:üîΩHaving a sweet voice, eyes, smell, body, and great splendor,

original: skad snyan mig dang ldan pa dang // dri lus gzi brjid chen po dang // de yi grib ma bdun du 'gyur //
analyzed: skad snyan mig dang ldan pa dang // dri lus gzi brjid chen po dang // de yi grib ma bdun du 'gyur //
translated: he has seven shadows.

original: mthong nas rnal 'byor pa'i sa mtshon /
analyzed: mthong nas rnal 'byor pa'i sa mtshon /
translated: Seeing him, the stage of the yogi is indicated.

original: de ni zos pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de ni zos pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely eating him,

original: skad cig la ni @131b mkha' spyod 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig la ni @131b mkha' spyod 'gyur //
translated: in an instant one will become a sky-goer.

original: mig dang ldan zhes pa ni mig yangs pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang ldan zhes pa ni mig yangs pa'o //
translated: Having eyes means having wide eyes.

original: dri'i lus zhes pa ni lus la tsandan gyi dri bro ba'o //
analyzed: dri'i lus zhes pa ni lus la tsandan gyi dri bro ba'o //
translated: Having a fragrant body means having the scent of sandalwood on the body.

original: gzi brjid che zhes pa ni lus che ba'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid che zhes pa ni lus che ba'o //
translated: Great splendor means having a large body.

original: grib ma bdun gyis skye ba bdun pa de'i mtshan nyid du yin no //
analyzed: grib ma bdun gyis skye ba bdun pa de'i mtshan nyid du yin no //
translated: Seven shadows are the characteristics of the seven-times-born one.

original: 'o na bsang ba'i skyon du gyur ba yin par sems la bzhag nas gsungs pa zos pa tsam gyis de ni mkha' spyod du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na bsang ba'i skyon du gyur ba yin par sems la bzhag nas gsungs pa zos pa tsam gyis de ni mkha' spyod du 'gyur te /
translated: But if one thinks that this is a fault of the ritual, then by eating it, one becomes a sky-goer.

original: de'i mod la mkha' spyod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mod la mkha' spyod du 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a sky-goer at that very moment.

original: 'dis ni de yang mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub thob pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni de yang mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub thob pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: This means that one attains the power of a sky-goer.

original: yang na skye ba bdun pa de'i sha zos pas mkha' spyod du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na skye ba bdun pa de'i sha zos pas mkha' spyod du 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, by eating the flesh of that seven-times-born one, one becomes a sky-goer.

original: mkha' spyod du 'gro zhe'o //
analyzed: mkha' spyod du 'gro zhe'o //
translated: One goes to the sky.

original: skad cig gis zhes pa ni de'i mod la ste dus thogs pa med pa'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig gis zhes pa ni de'i mod la ste dus thogs pa med pa'i don to //
translated: In an instant means at that very moment, and has the sense of no delay.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos grub des ni dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa ste gang dga' bral gyis thob pa'i dngos grub de smod pa yin no /'di ni dga' bral gyi ye shes kyis mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos grub des ni dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa ste gang dga' bral gyis thob pa'i dngos grub de smod pa yin no /'di ni dga' bral gyi ye shes kyis mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: For that very reason, that power is a reproach to the joy of separation, which means that the power attained by the joy of separation is a reproach to it. This means that one attains the power of a sky-goer by the wisdom of the joy of separation.

original: yang na lan bdun pa zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i kun nas sgyur zhing yang dang yang du goms pa des na drug pa nyid bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na lan bdun pa zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i kun nas sgyur zhing yang dang yang du goms pa des na drug pa nyid bdun pa yin no //
translated: Or, the one who is the seventh is the sixth itself, which is the seventh by the complete transformation of the inseparability of means and insight, and by the repeated practice of that.

original: lan bdun pa de rgyu de'i phyir na mtshon pa ste shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan bdun pa de rgyu de'i phyir na mtshon pa ste shes par bya ba'o //
translated: That seventh is the one to be known, the one to be understood, by that cause.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu cis khyad 'phags she na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rgyu cis khyad 'phags she na /
translated: By what cause is the characteristic distinguished?

original: lan bdun pa ste /
analyzed: lan bdun pa ste /
translated: The seventh is the one who is the seventh.

original: lan bdun du sgyur bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: lan bdun du sgyur bar bstan pas so //
translated: It is taught that he is the one who is the seventh by the teaching of the seven transformations.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: kye'i rdo rjes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rjes gsungs pas so //
translated: It is taught by Hevajra.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is taught by means and insight.üîΩFor that very reason,

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: the one who is the seventh is the one who is the seventh,

analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pas //

original: 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: The one who is the seventh is the one who is the seventh,

original: dga' bral gyi dga' ba la smod par byed pas /
analyzed: dga' bral gyi dga' ba la smod par byed pas /
translated: because of the revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy.üîΩThe revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy is the attainment of perfect complete enlightenment.üîΩThe one who is the seventh is the one who is the seventh,

original: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa /
analyzed: dga' bral dga' ba la smod pa /
translated: because of the revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'o //
translated: The revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy is the attainment of perfect complete enlightenment.üîΩThe one who is the seventh is the one who is the seventh,

original: skad snyan zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skad snyan zhes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: because of the revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy.üîΩThe revulsion of the joy of the absence of joy is the attainment of perfect complete enlightenment.üîΩThe one

original: mig dang ldan zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang ldan zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Endowed with eyes means the nature of the Dharma body.

original: dri lus zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid do /
analyzed: dri lus zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i bdag nyid do /
translated: Smelling body means the nature of the emanation body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sku gsum gyi bdag nyid des ni gzi brjid chen po ste sku gsum gyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sku gsum gyi bdag nyid des ni gzi brjid chen po ste sku gsum gyi sku'o //
translated: Therefore, by that nature of the three bodies, he is the great splendor, the body of the three bodies.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lan bdun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lan bdun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, he is the one with seven shadows.

original: grib ma bdun ni grib ma dang 'dra bas na grib ma bdun te /
analyzed: grib ma bdun ni grib ma dang 'dra bas na grib ma bdun te /
translated: Seven shadows means like a shadow.

original: de'i zhes pa ni drug pa nyid bdun pa'i grib ma ltar gzugs brnyan lta bur mtshon par bya'o /
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni drug pa nyid bdun pa'i grib ma ltar gzugs brnyan lta bur mtshon par bya'o /
translated: His means the sixth one, like the shadow of the seventh one, like a reflection.

original: mthong nas ni shes nas so //
analyzed: mthong nas ni shes nas so //
translated: Having seen means having known.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni de kho na nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The yogi is endowed with reality.

original: de'i ni drug pa rdo @132a * //
analyzed: de'i ni drug pa rdo @132a * //
translated: His means the sixth one, the vajra holder.

original: rje 'dzin pa de ni lnga po rnams zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rje 'dzin pa de ni lnga po rnams zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has entered the five.

original: de zos pa ni zos pa'o //
analyzed: de zos pa ni zos pa'o //
translated: Having eaten him means having eaten him.

original: de tsam gyis ni der 'khril bas so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni der 'khril bas so //
translated: By that much, he is embraced there.

original: mkha' spyod ni mkha' dbang po'o //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ni mkha' dbang po'o //
translated: The sky traveler is the lord of the sky.

original: de la spyod pas na mkha' spyod me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la spyod pas na mkha' spyod me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: consciousnesses, such as the mirror-like pristine consciousness, and so on.

original: skad cig gis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gis so ;
analyzed: skad cig gis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i skad cig gis so ;
translated: Instantaneously means in the instant of the connate [union].

original: /'gyur ni grub pa'i don to //
analyzed: /'gyur ni grub pa'i don to //
translated: Change means the meaning of accomplishment.üîΩ The sƒÅdhana of KurukullƒÅ, which is also explained as the subjugation of

original: ku ru ku lle'i sgrub thabs sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ku ru ku lle'i sgrub thabs sems can thams cad dbang du bya ba yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: all sentient beings, will now be explained.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The word all refers to the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: sems can gyi sgra ni srid gsum gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi sgra ni srid gsum gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The word sentient beings refers to the singularity of the three existences.

original: 'di nyid gsum ka 'di rnams tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsum ka 'di rnams tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: This is the nondifferentiation of all three of these.üîΩ Subjugation by this is the subjugation of the five pristine consciousnesses

original: 'di nyid kyis ni dbang du bya ba ni dbang du 'du ba ste ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid de ni dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni dbang du bya ba ni dbang du 'du ba ste ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid de ni dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: and the three kƒÅyas, which is the subjugation.

original: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don te /
translated: The word also has the meaning of distinction.

original: ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dbyer med par rtogs par grub na lta stangs grub pa yin pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: ye shes lnga dang sku gsum dbyer med par rtogs par grub na lta stangs grub pa yin pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: If one realizes the five gnoses and the three bodies as inseparable, then the view is established, by virtue of a special feature.

original: ku ru ku lle'i sgrub thabs ni ku ru ku lle zhes pa 'dis thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa bzhi bdag med mas rgyas btab pa gang aa'o //
analyzed: ku ru ku lle'i sgrub thabs ni ku ru ku lle zhes pa 'dis thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa bzhi bdag med mas rgyas btab pa gang aa'o //
translated: The means of achieving Kurukulla is Kurukulla. This is the means of achieving the indivisibility of method and wisdom, sealed by Nairatmya.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub thabs ni thabs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgrub thabs ni thabs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: That itself is the means of achievement, which is the means.

original: de bshad pa ni bshad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni bshad par bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is what is to be explained.

original: thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is the means itself.

original: kun rdzob du go sla ba'i don nyid do //üîΩgong du rtog pa bcu gnyis pas rgyas par gsungs pa mdo ru bsdu /
analyzed: kun rdzob du go sla ba'i don nyid do // gong du rtog pa bcu gnyis pas rgyas par gsungs pa mdo ru bsdu /
translated: The meaning is easy to understand in terms of the conventional.üîΩThe meaning of the twelve chapters above is summarized.

original: sngar 'bum phrag lnga pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje rtog pa bcu gnyis pas rgyas par gsungs nas da ni mdor bsdus te bstan par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngar 'bum phrag lnga pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje rtog pa bcu gnyis pas rgyas par gsungs nas da ni mdor bsdus te bstan par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that after previously elaborating on the Hevajra Tantra in fifty thousand lines with the twelve chapters, now it will be taught in brief.

original: yang na rtog pa bcu gnyis pas zhes pa ni rtog pa ni yang dag par rtogs pa ste sems so //
analyzed: yang na rtog pa bcu gnyis pas zhes pa ni rtog pa ni yang dag par rtogs pa ste sems so //
translated: Or else, the twelve concepts are the mind, which is the correct understanding.

original: bcu gnyis zhes pa ni gnyis kyi sgras thabs dang shes rab dag go //
analyzed: bcu gnyis zhes pa ni gnyis kyi sgras thabs dang shes rab dag go //
translated: The twelve are the two, means and insight.

original: de dbang po dang yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bcu'o //
analyzed: de dbang po dang yul gyi rang bzhin gyis bcu'o //
translated: They are ten by the nature of the sense organs and sense objects.

original: rtog pa yang rtog pa bcu gnyis pa des rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: rtog pa yang rtog pa bcu gnyis pa des rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The concept is the twelfth concept, by the nature of the three vajras, sense organs, sense objects, and consciousnesses.

original: rgyas par ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rgyas par ni spro ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In detail, by the method of emanation.

original: gang gsungs pa ni gang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa ni gang bstan pa'o //
translated: What is said is what is taught.

original: de nyid sngar te dang por mdor bsdu ba ni gzod ma nyid nas bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid sngar te dang por mdor bsdu ba ni gzod ma nyid nas bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That itself is the first, the summary, the nature of the summary from the beginning.

original: yang na de nyid mdor bsdus pa ni de bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid mdor bsdus pa ni de bsdus pa'o //
translated: Or else, that itself is the summary, the summary of that.

original: sngar ni dang po ste dang po ni gnyis su med pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngar ni dang po ste dang po ni gnyis su med pa'i don to //
translated: The first is the beginning, the first is the meaning of nonduality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir hr'i: las byung @132b ba'i lha mo ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir hr'i: las byung @132b ba'i lha mo ni //
translated: Therefore, the goddess arises from hri·∏•.

original: kha dog dmar zhing phyag bzhi ma //
analyzed: kha dog dmar zhing phyag bzhi ma //

original: mda' dang gzhu yi lag pa ma //
analyzed: mda' dang gzhu yi lag pa ma //
translated: She has no arms for a bow and arrow,

original: autpala dang lcags kyu 'dzin //
analyzed: autpala dang lcags kyu 'dzin //

original: / de'i las ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de'i las ni bya ba'o //

analyzed: lha mo ni lha mo'i bdag nyid spro ba'i rang bzhin no //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kha dog dmar zhing ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: For that very reason, she is red, the nature of the sign of passion.

analyzed: lag pa ni lnga po gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi ye shes gang la yod pa de ni mda' dang gzhu'i lag pa ma'o //

analyzed: dang ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

analyzed: autpala'i sgras ni byang chub kyi sems so //

original: a'am ni mkha' spyod ma'o //

analyzed: rdo rje snying po mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba brtag pa'i rgyal po rim par phye ba bcu gcig pa rdzogs so //

analyzed: // /'dir de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor bas de kho na nyid bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi lta stangs bzhi grub pas /

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa btab pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa btab pa //
translated: he supplicated the BhagavƒÅn:üîΩ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn Vajra Essence,

analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje snying po bdag / sangs rgyas kun gyi sku gcig pa // rab gnas mtshan nyid bzang @134a * //

analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa zhes pa ni rim pa ji ltar ba bzhin du'o //

analyzed: rab gnas mtshan nyid bzang ba ni ji ltar yang chos thams cad ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can no //
translated: The characteristic of consecration is as follows: all phenomena are characterized by the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the absence of any basis.üîΩIn the same way, it is reasonable that the characteristic of consecration of the deity is the elimination of the pride of ordinary beings through the realization of conventional truth, and the elimination of the pride of conditioned phenomena through the realization of ultimate truth.

analyzed: rdo rje snying po bdag nyid ni //

analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed ba'o //

analyzed: de nyid snying po ste gtso bo'o //

analyzed: 'dis ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das bstan to //
